meanings.definition: Deprive of the right to vote.
meanings.sent1: The new law could disenfranchise many citizens from voting in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent2: In some countries, certain groups are disenfranchised and cannot participate in elections.
meanings.sent3: When the voting machines malfunctioned, they seemed to disenfranchise everyone, even the candidates!
meanings.sent4: Being disenfranchised from voting is like being silenced in a room full of voices.
meanings.sent5: The act of disenfranchisement can leave individuals feeling powerless and unheard.

meanings.definition: Deprive of a privilege or right.
meanings.sent1: The strict rules could disenfranchise employees from taking breaks during work hours.
meanings.sent2: The unfair policy could disenfranchise students from accessing educational resources.
meanings.sent3: The magician's disappearing act seemed to disenfranchise the audience from their sense of reality!
meanings.sent4: Losing his favorite toy felt like being disenfranchised from a piece of his childhood.
meanings.sent5: Being disenfranchised from basic rights can lead to feelings of frustration and helplessness.
